contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}}<!-- This article was auto-generated by [[User:Polbot]]. --> {{Taxobox | name = Xenorhina eiponis | image = | status = DD | status_system = IUCN3.1 | regnum = [[Animalia]] | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Amphibia]] | ordo = [[Frog|Anura]] | familia = [[Microhylidae]] | genus = ''[[Xenorhina]]'' | species = '''''X. eiponis''''' | binomial = ''Xenorhina eiponis'' | binomial_authority = Blum & Menzies, 1989 | synonyms = }} '''''Xenorhina eiponis''''' is a species of [[frog]] in the [[Microhylidae]] family. It is [[Endemism|endemic]] to [[West Papua (region)|West Papua]], [[Indonesia]]. Its natural [[habitat]]s are subtropical or tropical moist [[montane forest]]s and rural gardens. ==Source== * Richards, S. & Price, D. 2004. [http://www.iucnredlist.org/search/details.php/58045/all Xenorhina eiponis]. [http://www.iucnredlist.org 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. ] Downloaded on 23 July 2007. {{Microhylidae-stub}} [[Category:Xenorhina]] [[Category:Amphibians of Western New Guinea]]
